# LDAP DC SRV Query:
; <<>> DiG 9.20.9-1-Debian <<>> SRV _ldap._tcp.dc._msdcs.example.com
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 12345
;; flags: qr rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 2, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 1

;; OPT PSEUDOSECTION:
; EDNS: version: 0, flags:; udp: 4096
;; QUESTION SECTION:
;_ldap._tcp.dc._msdcs.example.com.        IN      SRV

;; ANSWER SECTION:
_ldap._tcp.dc._msdcs.example.com. 600 IN SRV 0 100 389 dc1.example.com.
_ldap._tcp.dc._msdcs.example.com. 600 IN SRV 0 100 389 dc2.example.com.

;; Query time: 5 msec
;; SERVER: 8.8.8.8#53(8.8.8.8) (UDP)
;; WHEN: Sun Dec 14 19:00:38 EST 2025
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 210


# Kerberos SRV Query:
; <<>> DiG 9.20.9-1-Debian <<>> SRV _kerberos._tcp.example.com
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 12346
;; flags: qr rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 2, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 1

;; OPT PSEUDOSECTION:
; EDNS: version: 0, flags:; udp: 4096
;; QUESTION SECTION:
;_kerberos._tcp.example.com.      IN      SRV

;; ANSWER SECTION:
_kerberos._tcp.example.com. 600 IN SRV 0 100 88 dc1.example.com.
_kerberos._tcp.example.com. 600 IN SRV 0 100 88 dc2.example.com.

;; Query time: 5 msec
;; SERVER: 8.8.8.8#53(8.8.8.8) (UDP)
;; WHEN: Sun Dec 14 19:00:38 EST 2025
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 198
